page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY 3
page.content: THE STABLE BLOCK TO THE EAST OF BENINGBROUGH HALL IS NOW THE RECEPTION AREA, SHOP AND STUDY CENTRE AND THE ADJACENT RESTAURANT BUILT AT THE TIME OF THE RESTORATION GAINED A CIVIC AWARD IN 1980. THE VICTORIAN LAUNDRY DISPLAYS WASHING, MANGLING AND IRONING EQUIPMENT WITH FINE EXAMPLES OF HAND WORKED LINEN OF THE PERIOD. THE HOUSE PARK AND GARDENS ARE OPEN TO THE PUBLIC FROM APRIL TO OCTOBER AND IN ADDITION THERE ARE SPECIAL EVENTS THROUGHOUT THE SEASON. IN 1985 52,000 PEOPLE VISITED THE PRORERTY. IT IS NOW THE HOME OF A COLLECTION OF PAINTINGS LOANED BY THE NATIONAL PORTRAIT GALLERY AND PRIVATE COLLECTORS REFLECTING LIFE OF THE PERIOD. IN FORMER DAYS A FERRY PLIED ACROSS THE OUSE TO NUN MONKTON PRIORY. THIS WAS USED BY CATHOLICS TO ATTEND CHURCH IN NUN MONKTON NOW CLOSED.
